metadata.title: CVE-2020-27821 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the memory management API of QEMU during theinitialization of a memory region cache. This issue could lead to anout-of-bounds write access to the MSI-X table while performing MMIOoperations. A guest user may abuse this flaw to crash the QEMU process onthe host, resulting in a denial of service. This flaw affects QEMU versionsprior to 5.2.0.

criterions.comment: qemu: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
